summary: The Federal Protective Service protects about 9,000 federal facilities and their occupants. FPS is part of the Department of Homeland Security, but it's been moved to two "parent agencies" within the department in the last 15 years. Reorganization can affect an agency's performance; after each move, FPS faced new duties and challenges. But where's the best fit? We reviewed 8 potential parent agencies and found...
title: Federal Protective Service: DHS Should Take Additional Steps to Evaluate Organizational Placement
